page.title: 09Willie, Patchway's Clown
page.content: Willie the Clown's real name is Stephen William Blaber. He was born in Eastbourne in 1921. He worked first on a farm at Gaunts Earthcott, near Patchway, and then came to Patchway in 1954. He then worked on the dustbin lorry for 16 years. Afterwards he became a roadsweeper, sweeping up the rubbish. He keeps Patchway very clean. He dressed up as a clown and entertained people in hospital, old people homes, schools and play schools, raising lots of money for charity. He helps old people by making them laugh and feel better, and by doing their shopping and things like that. He visits them every morning to see if they are allright. When Lady Diana and Prince Charles got married we had a street party and we invited Willie. He came in a clowns outfit with a big comb.
